summary: This bill, H.R. 2827, concerns the settlement of land disputes involving the Miami Tribe of Oklahoma in Illinois. It grants the U.S. Court of Federal Claims jurisdiction to hear a specific land claim under the 1805 Treaty of Grouseland, regardless of the statute of limitations. This jurisdiction expires one year after the bill's enactment if the claim isn't filed.  The bill also extinguishes all other land claims by the Miami Tribe in Illinois, except for the one addressed by the court.
